events.message: The claimant reported a collision involving their vehicle and a roadside barrier on April 30th around 6pm.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on the description mentioning vehicle collision damage.
An agent was assigned promptly to manage the vehicle accident claim and contact the claimant for next steps.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the car accident claim and assured timely processing.
Documents requested include police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates from certified garages.
Claimant submitted all required documents including accident photos, police report, and mechanic's damage assessment.
Investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision started with review of submitted evidence and reports.
Investigation completed and confirmed that the claim is valid with no indication of fraud or misrepresentation.
A settlement amount covering the vehicle repairs and associated costs was proposed and sent to the claimant.
The claimant provided positive feedback on the clear communication and speed of the claim settlement process.
The claim was approved by the claims manager following the claimantâ€™s acceptance of the proposed settlement.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the claimant's bank account to cover vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after the claimant confirmed receipt of payment and repair completion.
The claim file for the vehicle collision case was archived in the company records for future reference.
